comments.body: Wouldn't we want to opposite where `validate_certs` is the source of truth considering `skip_certificate_validation` will be deprecated?

Well, the reason I do it like this is because `validate_certs` defaults to `$true` and this is how we want it. I don't want to have a default for `skip_certificate_validation` because I want to know whether it was set deliberately (testing for `$null`).

So this is for convenience. At some point we will deprecate `skip_certificate_validation` and by that time this is moot anyway IMO.

BTW We set a warning when this deprecated option is still used, so I expect most people to move away ASAP...

    - If C(skip_certificate_validation) was set, it overrides this option.
